publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-275# Nicola Sturgeon: Pollokshaws Sports Centre—That the Parliament recognises the importance of accessible sport and leisure facilities in communities around Scotland; notes with regret the decision of Glasgow City Council to close the well-used Pollokshaws Sports Centre and urges reversal of that decision, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to highlight the positive role that community sports facilities can play in combating social exclusion and improving the lives of people in our most deprived communities. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Ms Sandra White*

S1M-275# Nicola Sturgeon: Pollokshaws Sports Centre-That the Parliament recognises the importance of accessible sport and leisure facilities in communities around Scotland; notes with regret the decision of Glasgow City Council to close the well-used Pollokshaws Sports Centre and urges reversal of that decision, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to highlight the positive role that community sports facilities can play in combating social exclusion and improving the lives of people in our most deprived communities. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Ms Sandra White
S1M-275# Pollokshaws Sports Centre (lodged on 11 November 1999) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-275# Pollokshaws Sports Centre (lodged on 11 November 1999) Robert Brown*, Gordon Jackson*
